results.title: Effect of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) on Conduction System Disease.
authors: Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) Collaborative Research Group
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE: Incident @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Conduction_System_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000075224 @@@conduction system disease@@@ is significantly reduced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy and is independently associated with multiple clinical factors.

citations.NLM: Dewland TA, Soliman EZ, Davis BR, Magnani JW, Yamal JM, Piller LB, Haywood LJ, Alonso A, Albert CM, Marcus GM, Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) Collaborative Research Group. Effect of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) on Conduction System Disease. JAMA Intern Med. 2016 Aug 1;176(8):1085-92. PMID: 27367818
citations.BibTeX: @article{27367818, title={Effect of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) on Conduction System Disease.}, author={Dewland TA and Soliman EZ and Davis BR and Magnani JW and Yamal JM and Piller LB and Haywood LJ and Alonso A and Albert CM and Marcus GM and Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) Collaborative Research Group}, journal={JAMA Intern Med}, volume={176}, number={8}, pages={1085-92}}

results.title: Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: Previous work has demonstrated that treatment of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was associated with a reduced incidence of a composite @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Conduction_System_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000075224 @@@conduction system disease@@@ endpoint and also @DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@left bundle branch block@@@ (@DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@LBBB@@@) compared with @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Okin PM, Kjeldsen SE, Devereux RB. Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients. J Hypertens. 2019 Mar;37(3):629-635. PMID: 30676480
citations.BibTeX: @article{30676480, title={Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients.}, author={Okin PM and Kjeldsen SE and Devereux RB}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={37}, number={3}, pages={629-635}}
